alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 2:52PM CST until February 17 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Growth and Spread of Wildfires Possible Thursday... .A weak cold front will sweep through Deep South Texas Thursday morning. Moderate north to northwest winds will develop behind the front as relative humidity values fall into the teens through the afternoon. The combination of moderate winds and very dry air will increase the potential for erratic wildfire activity with rapid growth and spread. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM CST THURSDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 9 AM to 8 PM CST Thursday. * AFFECTED AREA...Brooks and Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...9 AM to 8 PM Thursday. * WIND...North to northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
